name: ENGLISH OPENING
idea: White controls d5 without playing e4! It's a flexible opening that can transpose into many systems (Queen's Gambit, Catalan, Reversed Sicilian positions). The main idea is to fianchetto the Bishop on g2 to control the long diagonal and the center from afar. White avoids the theoretical lines of 1.e4 and 1.d4 while keeping all options open. It's the opening for strategic players who want to impose their style.
errors_white: Playing without a plan: you must choose between g3/Bg2 (fianchetto), Nc3/e3 (classical) or d4 (transposition)
Pushing d4 too early without preparation: can allow Black to seize the initiative in the center
Neglecting the center: the fianchetto alone is not enough, you must also prepare d4 or e4
errors_black: Playing ...e5 automatically: gives White a Reversed Sicilian with an extra tempo
Being too passive: Black must fight for the center with ...d5 or ...e5
Ignoring the Bg2: this Bishop controls the long diagonal a8-h1
development: Controls d5 and prepares Nc3 - first step towards center control
The Bg2 fianchetto is the main plan - the Bishop dominates the long diagonal
Nc3 controls d5, Nf3 prepares classical development
d3 (solid) or d4 (central) according to the chosen plan
e3 (solid) or e4 (aggressive) for a pawn center
Kingside castle after g3/Bg2/Nf3 - safe position and active Rook on e1/d1

traps.name: Gambit Trap
traps.desc: 1...e5 (Reversed Sicilian). If 2.Nc3 Nf6 3.Nf3?! e4! gains time. AVOID (White): Play 2.g3! first, or 3.d3 to control e4.

traps.name: Symmetry Trap
traps.desc: 1...c5 (Symmetrical). If White plays Nc3/Nf3/g3 without d4, Black equalizes easily. AVOID (White): Prepare d4 with Nf3, g3, Bg2 then d4 at the right moment.

traps.name: Center Trap
traps.desc: 1...e6 2.d4 d5 transposes into the Queen's Gambit! If Black is not prepared, they can suffer. AVOID (Black): Know the Queen's Gambit or play 1...c5/1...e5 to avoid it.

variants.name: Reversed Sicilian
variants.uci: c2c4 e7e5 b1c3 g8f6 g2g3 d7d5 c4d5 f6d5
variants.white_plan: White has a Sicilian with an extra tempo! Fianchetto Bg2, then Nf3, 0-0 and d3. Slow pressure on e5.
variants.black_plan: Black has a strong center with e5. Develop ...Nc6, ...Be7/...Bc5, ...0-0 and maintain central presence.

variants.name: Symmetrical Defense
variants.uci: c2c4 c7c5 b1c3 b8c6 g2g3 g7g6 f1g2 f8g7
variants.white_plan: Double fianchetto possible. Play Nf3, 0-0, d3, then look for e3/e4 or b3/Bb2 for pressure.
variants.black_plan: Mirror structure! ...Nf6, ...0-0, ...d6, then ...Rb8 and ...b5 for queenside counterplay.

variants.name: Hedgehog System
variants.uci: c2c4 g8f6 b1c3 e7e6 g1f3 b7b6 g2g3 c8b7
variants.white_plan: The Hedgehog is solid but passive. Play Bg2, 0-0, d4, and look to exploit the space with e4 or Nd5.
variants.black_plan: Compact structure like a hedgehog! ...Be7, ...0-0, ...d6, ...c5, ...Qc7. Wait then counterattack with ...d5 or ...b5.
